alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 17 at 1:06PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River At Comus affecting Humboldt County zone. .Warm temperatures may melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. For the Lower Humboldt...including Comus...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Humboldt River At Comus. * WHEN...From late Tuesday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.5 feet, Moderate Flood Stage. Moderate lowland flooding throughout the reach, with some rural roads flooded. Minor flooding in the lower parts of Winnemucca with storm drain backups. Main area impacted is between the Union Pacific Railroad and Second street beneath Interstate 80. Property damage in Winnemucca is minimal. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 PM PDT Monday the stage was 6.4 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Humboldt River Comus 9.5 6.4 Mon 12 pm PD 8.4 10.0 10.3 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 915 PM PDT.
